rows.title: Iterating through a Collection, avoiding ConcurrentModificationException when removing objects in a loop

219: <p><a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/ConcurrentHashMap.html" rel="nofollow">ConcurrentHashMap</a> or <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/ConcurrentLinkedQueue.html" rel="nofollow">ConcurrentLinkedQueue</a> or <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/ConcurrentSkipListMap.html" rel="nofollow">ConcurrentSkipListMap</a> may be another option, because they will never throw any ConcurrentModificationException, even if you remove or add item.</p>

<p>you can also use <strong>Recursion</strong></p>

<p>Recursion in java is a process in which a method calls itself continuously. A method in java that calls itself is called recursive method.</p>
